bill.title: Social promotion; prohibit of students in Grade 3 who are reading deficient and require intensive reading instruction.
bill.description: An Act To Prohibit The Social Promotion Of Students In Grade 3 Who Have A Reading Deficiency, Except That Good Cause Be Shown; To Require That Those Students Who Are Determined To Have Reading Deficiency Be Retained In Grade 3, Or If Promoted For Good Cause, Be Provided With Intensive Reading Instruction; To Require The Reassessment Of A Student's Reading Proficiency At The Conclusion Of Intensive Reading Instruction; To Require Local School Districts To Provide Parents Of Students With A Reading Deficiency With Certain Information; To Prohibit The Assignment Of A Student To A Grade Level Based Solely On Age Or Other Factors That Constitute Social Promotion; To Prescribe The Good Cause Exemption For Which A Student With Reading Deficiency May Be Promoted; To Require Each School District To Establish A Reading Enhancement And Acceleration Development Initiative And An Intensive Acceleration Class And Prescribe The Purpose Of Each; To Prescribe Annual Reporting Requirements; To Provide That The Provisions Of This Act Shall Be Severable; To Provide For The Repeal Of This Act On July 1, 2022; And For Related Purposes.
